poem:
Title: "On Stones Whispering Injustice"

Red glares of Gaza,
the choked lament of olive trees -
Unheard in Hague's cold corridors of justice.
South Africa, your trumpet-call,
awakens old notions of law.
Green figs, blooming amidst bullet-hail,
dig roots into the blood-smoke air.
War, once a lyric, crumbles -
resolves into the grit of denials.
So much depends
upon a voice,
on scales, on truth.
